Line 22: Line 22:
ElBaradei was born and raised in [[Cairo]], [[Egypt]]. He was one of five children of Mostafa ElBaradei, an attorney who headed the Egyptian Bar Association and often found himself at odds with the regime of Egyptian President [[Gamal Abdel Nasser]]. ElBaradei's father was also a supporter of [[democratic]] rights in Egypt, supporting a free press and a legal system that was independent.<ref name=NB_ME>[http://www.notablebiographies.com/newsmakers2/2006-Ei-La/ElBaradei-Mohamed.html Notable Biographies: Mohamed ElBaradei]</ref> ElBaradei followed in his father's footsteps and earned his law degree at the [[University of Cairo]] in 1962.<ref>[http://www.achievement.org/autodoc/page/elb0bio-1 Academy of Achievement: Mohamed ElBaradei (Biography)]</ref>
ElBaradei was born and raised in [[Cairo]], [[Egypt]]. He was one of five children of Mostafa ElBaradei, an attorney who headed the Egyptian Bar Association and often found himself at odds with the regime of Egyptian President [[Gamal Abdel Nasser]]. ElBaradei's father was also a supporter of [[democratic]] rights in Egypt, supporting a free press and a legal system that was independent.<ref name=NB_ME>[http://www.notablebiographies.com/newsmakers2/2006-Ei-La/ElBaradei-Mohamed.html Notable Biographies: Mohamed ElBaradei]</ref> ElBaradei followed in his father's footsteps and earned his law degree at the [[University of Cairo]] in 1962.<ref>[http://www.achievement.org/autodoc/page/elb0bio-1 Academy of Achievement: Mohamed ElBaradei (Biography)]</ref>
â
ElBaradei is married to Aida El-Kachef, an early childhood teacher. Their daughter, Laila, is a lawyer and lives in [[London]].
+
ElBaradei is married to Aida El-Kachef, an early childhood teacher. Their daughter, ''Laila ElBaradei'', is a lawyer and lives in [[London]]. In September 2010, A page was created by an anonymous facebook user who claimed to be a close friend of ''Laila ElBaradei''. The page displayed at least thirty photos of ElBaradeiâs family showing his daughter in swimsuits at the beach and at events where glasses of alcohol appear to be present<ref name="Facebook activists maintain support for ElBaradei despite photos">[http://www.almasryalyoum.com/en/node/76871 Facebook activists maintain support for ElBaradei despite photos]</ref>. The pageâs architect has also posted a screen shot of Lailaâs alleged Facebook profile page showing that she identifies herself as ''[[agnostic]]''<ref name="Facebook activists maintain support for ElBaradei despite photos"></ref>. In an interview with a local paper, ElBaradei accused President ''[[Hosni Mubarak]]''âs regime of waging a campaign of âsheer liesâ against him with these photos<ref name="Facebook activists maintain support for ElBaradei despite photos"></ref>.
  +   +
{{Quotation|
  +
'''"This is typical and the only way the regime responds to those calling for democracy, political reforms, social justice and preserving people's human rights"<ref name="Facebook activists maintain support for ElBaradei despite photos"></ref>.'''|Mohamed ElBaradei
  +
